reviews.review: juego muy bueno y adictivo

I managed to break the physics and everything fell thru the floor. I could not complete the level for the companion cube fell thru the floor when dropped. I don't understand why what happened happened but it was fixed when I restarted the game. Fun little puzzle game to play while on a plane or something. Beware of the level with turrets and classroom with radio, the storage closet is not the place you want to place a portal.

Maravilloso juego de todavia mejor el segundo. La manera en que juega con la fisica y los portales para hacer puzzles es muy interesante. Toda persona que tenga una cuenta en steam deberia tener los dos juegos de portal.

This game is one of Valve's best creations yet. Over 10 years old but gameplay still feels fresh and unique since no other game can do that without being called for cloning. Puzzles are fun to solve, story is linear but is in universe with the Half-Life series so many theories are still being unsolved. You have a portal gun and you use it to solve puzzles which is really fun and unique. I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes unique puzzle games, and First person perspective games because this game is all about those two. This game is very cheap when it is on sale so usually 90% off so 1 dollar for so much fun and a unique experience is definitely worth buying at least in my opinion.
Make Portal 2 pls
A timeless classic that has aged extremely well.

Never liked any monsters in any games including Half-Life, nor I had mastered in shooting terrorists in Counter-Strike, I found Portal my best destination on Steam.

Portal 1 is easy enough to start with a good story. For someone like me who dislikes stories in first person nor solving a hard puzzle, roaming around in the same place for half an hour, Portal 1 is really the one for me.

The graphics is also awesome. If you are concerned with it because of its realease date, just go and check Half-Life 2. I even think Portal 1 is better than Half-Life 2 in graphics because it is simple and elegant. 

Of course, Portal 2 is also a great game, but I just like that Apeture Science in a neat, clean order. It conveys a nice science feeling, and GlaDOS is excellent as well.

For guys interested in it, I recommend the Valve Complete Pack or the Portal Pack in Summer Sales.(which is coming up very soon) Valve's game may never count to three, but each of them has a recommended rate of 90%.

GLaD to play this again today as part of the Spring Cleaning Task. I was surprised to clear the game in a couple of hours because I remember when it first came out I put in countless hours to solve the puzzles. Playing it again and I still found it fun and entertaining, especially GLaDOS. One of the few games where you would watch the entire end game credits. Amazing song.

Overall a must play game which set a new standard for the FPS puzzle platform genre.

Portal is a nice puzzle and platformer game. So if you dislike puzzle games you probably shouldn't play it because that's really all it is. This game can get a bit frustrating at times as well so keep that in mind. That's all the warnings I have about the game. You're a test subject going around to complete puzzles with your Portal Gun and your fancy boots to escape the facility. It also has some hidden lore buried within it as well for those lore diggers like myself. There are some jokes thrown around as well which adds more enjoyment to the game. I personally thought that this game was worth the time and money that I invested into it. Now I'll talk about the content of Portal.

In the game, you start off in a little room where you, the test subject have been held. Your job is to listen to GLaDOS and follow her instructions. You then leave the starting room and go into a test chamber. A few test chambers later you find yourself in a room with the Portal Gun which allows you to place a portal. The portals connect with each other and allow you to teleport to wherever it's placed as long as you have both portals placed down. At first, you start off with one color portal that you can use with the gun and GLaDOS places the other. But later on, you get access to place both portals yourself. You then continue completing test chambers. As you progress the game teaches you new mechanics to use in later chambers. The puzzles increase in difficulty so don't get too cocky. As you get toward the end of the game you don't really complete test chambers anymore but rather find ways to get closer to the exit. But you'll have to fight a certain somebody to get out alive. I can't really think of much else to say about the content of Portal. As soon as you complete the game you can go back to any chamber you wish and replay it or you can just start another game entirely.

Like I said previously I personally thought this was worth the time and money I invested in the game. I enjoy solving puzzles and I also enjoy lore hidden games so this was something with a cherry on the top.

Even more than ten years after its release, Portal stands as a blockbuster, benchmark title powered by Valve's hearty Source engine. The dark, dark humor of the zip-quick game, delivered by the sinister, omnipresent GlaDOS to silent Chell, verberates in the minds of players as they frantically plow through each inventive physics-based puzzle to find a way out of the claustrophic testing chambers. Art direction and tense music add to this constant, foreboding anxiety which drives the player increasingly faster towards the game's explosive finish. The novelty of a first-person shooter whose gun creates new realities instead of destroying the current one echoes in the heart of the conscientious gamer, distilling the realization that this singular title carved out a new reality in the gaming world that will forever stand as a guidepost to its posterity. 10/10.

One of my favorite games, Portal excels at crafting and delivering one of the most unique experiences that I've yet to see replicated. It is an atmospheric masterpieces that excels in both look and sound. Combined with the simple yet engaging puzzles and Ellen McLain's excellent performance as GLaDOS, it leaves such a vivid impression on you after all these years.
It's portal, what do you want? Go play it.

Me ha gustado. El humor que tiene  es genial. Las pruebas en las que se divide el juego son divertidas y en algunos casos te va a tocar pensar un buen rato, pero en el momento en el que entiendes las posibilidades que te dan los portales se hace relativamente sencillo. Por lo que he estado viendo la duración media es de unas 4 horas - 4 horas y media, duración corta pero que se hace bastante entretenida. En general, si te gustan los juegos de puzzles es una buena elección de la que no te arrepentirás .

La única pega que pondria es la duración , los portales tienen un potencial increible para no haber añadido más pruebas y nuevas mecánicas .
